data.text:
@kjoules For context, that would be like America reporting >9000 deaths in one day.
Even at the height of the 2nd wave without vaccines, the highest was less than half that
@kjoules One would like to think that one day there will be a public enquiry into this absolute clusterf**k, and that heads will roll. But I won’t hold my breath…

According to Our World in Data, at a 7-day rolling average of 27.75 deaths per million people per day, Hong Kong’s death rate is higher than any of the 60 most populous countries in the world at any given point in time during the entire pandemic, beating Peru (26.20, April 2021) https://t.co/JOtQSXXP1h

25150 new Covid cases in Hong Kong. 
Week-on-week ratio: 2.09 (↓0.59 from yesterday) https://t.co/Zjz1YLe5GQ
